articles.title: Preparatory Committee Inaugurated in Russia
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee Inaugurated in Russia 
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of a preparatory committee of the Russian public was held in Moscow on March 23 to commemorate the Day of the Sun.
 A resolution was adopted at the ceremony. It highly praised President Kim Il Sung who, steering the Korean revolution, defeated the Japanese and U.S. imperialists and wisely led the Korean people's struggle to build a developed great powerful socialist country to a brilliant victory.    
 The resolution introduced the members of the preparatory committee headed by Vladimir Tolstikov who is chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK. It said that the committee would organize colorful functions such as a meeting, seminar, photo exhibition and film show to commemorate the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung.

Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works Published in Austria
articles.content:
Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works Published in Austria 
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- A collection of works of President Kim Il Sung "The Three Charters for National Reunification" was published by the Joseph Gebauer Publishing House of Austria on Mar. 25.
 Its chief said he was glad that his publishing house brought out works of the President, a world recognized statesman, and wished the Korean people success in their struggle to reunify the country, true to the behests of the President.

North Side's Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
North Side's Delegation Leaves
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the north side led by An Kyong Ho, director of the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, left here today to participate in an inter-Korean meeting for reunification to be held in Longjin, China, to commemorate the 15th anniversary of the Pyongyang visit of Rev. Mun Ik Hwan whose nickname was Late Spring.
